newsitem.title: USA: Halliburton sued for patent infringement.
newsitem.headline: Halliburton sued for patent infringement.

text.p: Landmark Graphics Corp, a division of Halliburton, and CAEX, a unit of Landmark, were served Tuesday with a patent infringement complaint filed by Amoco Corp, according to a news release issued by Coherence Technology Co Inc.
The suit was filed in U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Oklahoma, the news release said.

The complaint seeks monetary damages and injunctive relief to prevent Landmark and CAEX from distributing and using the Landmark Continuity Cube program, which allegedly infringes on Amoco's patent, the news release said.

The seismic processing methodology covered by the patent provides a method for imaging subsurface faults and stratigraphy in oil and gas exploration and production, and is available commercially worldwide only from Coherence Technology through its Coherence Cube products, the news release said.
